citations.narrative:
The enclosure housing the zebu and water buffalo backs up to a building/carport type structure. The wood panel at the
back corner of the side of the building that is accessible by the animals has been damaged. There is a large hole/opening
and a large loose board. Sharp points of wire and nails are present. The animals may injure themselves on the sharp
points and loose board. The outdoor housing for the zebu and water buffalo shall be maintained in good repair. Correct by
11/30/24.

The enclosures for the African crested porcupines, coatimundi and kangaroo are in need of cleaning. A large amount of
fecal material and food waste has accumulated and mixed in with shavings/dirt. An excessive number of flies were noted.
Regular frequent cleaning of enclosures is necessary to prevent contamination of the animals, to minimize spread of
disease, to reduce odors and to help with pest control. Excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures as often as
necessary to prevent cleaning related issues. Correct by 11/2/24.

An excessive number of flies were present in/around the enclosures, the food/water containers and the animals
themselves in the African crested porcupine, coatimundi and kangaroo enclosures. No fly control measures were
observed. The licensee reports that fly control products are on order but have not yet been received. Flies can cause
irritation to the animals and spread disease causing organisms. A safe and effective program for the control of insects
shall be established and maintained. Correct by 11/15/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The enclosure housing the zebu and water buffalo backs up to a building/carport type structure. The wood panel at the 
back corner of the side of the building that is accessible by the animals has been damaged. There is a large hole/opening 
and a large loose board. Sharp points of wire and nails are present. The animals may injure themselves on the sharp 
points and loose board. The outdoor housing for the zebu and water buffalo shall be maintained in good repair. Correct by 
11/30/24. 
3.131(a) 
   
Sanitation. 
The enclosures for the African crested porcupines, coatimundi and kangaroo are in need of cleaning. A large amount of 
fecal material and food waste has accumulated and mixed in with shavings/dirt. An excessive number of flies were noted. 
Regular frequent cleaning of enclosures is necessary to prevent contamination of the animals, to minimize spread of 
disease, to reduce odors and to help with pest control. Excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures as often as 
necessary to prevent cleaning related issues. Correct by 11/2/24. 
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
An excessive number of flies were present in/around the enclosures, the food/water containers and the animals 
themselves in the African crested porcupine, coatimundi and kangaroo enclosures. No fly control measures were 
observed. The licensee reports that fly control products are on order but have not yet been received. Flies can cause 
irritation to the animals and spread disease causing organisms. A safe and effective program for the control of insects 
shall be established and maintained. Correct by 11/15/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
